Bringing History to Life for Today's Students
Why Civic Education Matters Now More Than Ever
My academic journey and teaching experience in sociology, political science, and K-12 education.
Academic background, teaching credentials, and professional experience of educator and researcher Violet Gash.

My educational journey has been shaped by a deep commitment to understanding society, promoting justice, and preparing to make a difference in students' lives through teaching.

## Current Studies

### Bachelor of Arts in Sociology
**California State University, Fresno** | Expected 2025

My sociology degree provides me with a deep understanding of social structures, inequality, and the forces that shape our communities. Through coursework in social theory, research methods, and specialized topics, I've developed critical thinking skills and a sociological imagination that informs all aspects of my teaching.

Key coursework includes:
- Social Inequality and Stratification
- Race, Class, and Gender
- Research Methods and Data Analysis
- Social Movements and Collective Action
- Sociology of Education

### Multiple Subject Teaching Credential
**California State University, Fresno** | Expected 2025

Currently completing my Multiple Subject Teaching Credential, which prepares me to teach all subjects at the elementary level. This program combines educational theory, child development, and extensive classroom practice.

Program components:
- Curriculum Design and Lesson Planning
- Classroom Management and Student Engagement
- Assessment and Differentiated Instruction
- Inclusive Education and Special Needs Support
- Student Teaching Practicum

## Completed Education

### Dual Associate Degree
**Clovis Community College** | Completed 2022

- Associate of Arts in Political Science
- Associate of Arts in Sociology

This foundation in social sciences sparked my passion for civic education and understanding how political and social systems shape individual lives and communities. The interdisciplinary approach prepared me well for upper-division sociology work and research.

## Teaching & Tutoring Experience

### Private Tutor
**Self-Employed** | 2022 - Present

- Provide one-on-one and small group tutoring for K-12 students across all subjects
- Specialize in history, social studies, civics, and government education
- Work with students with developmental disabilities including autism spectrum disorder and ADHD
- Develop customized lesson plans and adaptive teaching materials
- Maintain regular communication with parents regarding student progress

### Student Teacher
**Fresno Unified School District** | 2024

- Completed student teaching practicum in elementary classroom
- Designed and delivered lessons across all subject areas
- Implemented differentiated instruction to meet diverse learning needs
- Collaborated with mentor teacher on classroom management and assessment
- Engaged with parents and participated in school community events

### Research Assistant
**California State University, Fresno** | 2023 - Present

- Contribute to genocide prevention research examining historical patterns and contemporary prevention strategies
- Participate in midwives and doulas mapping project analyzing healthcare access
- Conduct literature reviews and data analysis
- Present research findings at undergraduate research symposiums

## Professional Development

- Special Education Teaching Strategies Workshop (2024)
- Trauma-Informed Teaching Practices Seminar (2024)
- Culturally Responsive Pedagogy Training (2023)
- Student Mental Health First Aid Certification (2023)

## Skills & Competencies

### Teaching Skills
- Lesson planning and curriculum design
- Differentiated instruction
- Classroom management
- Assessment and evaluation
- Parent-teacher communication

### Subject Matter Expertise
- History and social studies
- Civic education and government

### Inclusive Education
- Adaptive teaching strategies
- Special education support
- Universal Design for Learning

- Individualized Education Plan (IEP) implementation

### Research Skills
- Qualitative and quantitative research methods
- Data analysis (SPSS, qualitative coding)
- Academic writing and literature review
- Research ethics and IRB protocols
